answers.answer: I've found that with doctor's you must be persistent, and no, they aren't always right.  Different states and different labs have different numbers for what is considered "normal" for thyroid levels so you could still be in "normal" range according to lab, but still be hypo or hyper for your particular body.  BE PERSISTENT, that is all I can say! It is good that you are finding people to talk to. Also, have they looked at a pituitary problem as well? Hope you find what you are looking for.
